stories.text:
We had a catastrophic incident where vultr had a hardware node failure of some sort and we lost some data (we do take offsite backups but lost few hours of data that was not backed up yet and this particular customer has lot of activity).

After the whole night on tickets with vultr, their reply is "sorry suck it. we will give you 60 days credit". We pay them thousands per month for tons of customers. Not trying to bash them but more interested in asking HN if EC2 etc is more reliable ?

We do use EC2 for some and DigitalOcean as well to mix it up. I am thinking that we should completely move to EC2 as I have found AWS Support to be the best.

Is this just the way it is with VPS companies or is EC2 more reliable ?
stories.title: Ask HN: Vultr lost customer data. How is EC2?

stories.text:
Hello. My name is Vishnu, and I'm a 16 year old high schooler with an interest for software development and computer science.

I live in the Toronto area and I was just wondering where I can find opportunities for part-time software developer jobs or summer 2022 internship opportunities.

If anyone has any opportunities, please let me know. My resume is available at https://www.vishnus.me/VishnuSatishResume.pdf. My GitHub profile is https://github.com/vishnupsatish. Thank you. (I'm also a lurker on Hacker News ;)
stories.title: Internships for High Schoolers
